simacogo

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • simacogo.State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents the State of a game of Simacogo.
    Author:
    Patrick Drucker

    • Method Detail

      • isTerminalState

        public boolean isTerminalState()
        Returns whether this state is a game-ending state (all spots in the grid have either an 'X' or an 'O') or not.
        Returns:
        true if this grid is in a game-ending state; false otherwise

      • successors

        public java.util.ArrayList<State> successors()
        Successor function for States. Returns an ArrayList of States that contain all States that can be reached from this State.
        Returns:
        nextStates a list of possible States that are reachable from this State

      • dropPiece

        public State dropPiece(int columnNumber)
        Drops a piece into a specified column number and returns the resulting State.
        Parameters:
        columnNumber - the column that a piece will be dropped into
        Returns:
        nextState the new State if a piece were to be dropped in columnNumber; null if column is full

      • numAvailableSpaces

        public int numAvailableSpaces(int columnNumber)
        Returns an integer that represents the number of available spaces in a column.
        Parameters:
        columnNumber - a column number
        Returns:
        the number of available spaces in a specified column number

      • columnIsAvailable

        public boolean columnIsAvailable(int columnNumber)
        Checks if a column would be available to drop another piece.
        Parameters:
        columnNumber - number of a column
        Returns:
        false if the column is full; true otherwise
